Python Pandas: Copying a Column of a DataFrame

October 03, 2018



Problem Statement 1: Updating An Existing DataFrame

Given a sample pandas DataFrame df with two columns containing user name and age, we want to update df with a copy of the age column.

Executing df['age_copy'] = df['age'] will update the DataFrame df with a newly-added column labeled age_copy.

Problem Statement 2: Creating a New DataFrame

Given a sample pandas DataFrame df with two columns containing user name and age, we want to create a new DataFrame, df_new, with a copy of dfâ€™s age column.

Executing df_new = pd.DataFrame({'age_copy': df['age']}) creates a new DataFrame df_new with a column labeled age_copy,which is populated with content copied from df['age'].
